meanings.definition: To reduce the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: She kept devaluing her old toys by leaving them out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to devalue the currency caused chaos in the market.
meanings.sent3: By devaluing her collection of seashells, she unintentionally created a beach-themed art installation.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism was like devaluing a precious gem into a mere pebble.
meanings.sent5: The act of devaluing a painting turned it from a masterpiece into a mere doodle.

meanings.definition: To diminish the importance or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: The negative comments were devaluing her hard work on the project.
meanings.sent2: The lack of maintenance was devaluing the once beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: His habit of devaluing compliments by making jokes made him the class clown.
meanings.sent4: The constant comparison to others was devaluing her sense of self-worth.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the statue was devaluing its historical significance.
